taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek monos , one, and ptilon , soft feather, alluding to pappus of M. bellidiforme , a solitary plumose bristle]

bio:treatment.discussion: Both species of Monoptilon are decumbent to prostrate, hispid annuals with campanulate involucres, white coiling rays, obovoid compressed cypselae, and chromosome number of 2n = 16. The genus was placed by G. L. Nesom (1994) as sister to Chaetopappa.

key_statement.description: Stems yellow-green; phyllary margins herbaceous; disc corollas loosely strigose proximally; pappi scarious cups 0.1–0.4 mm plus 1 apically plumose bristle usually equaling disc corollas

Stems often prominently reddish purple; phyllary margins proximally with sharply delimited, white-scarious portions, lacerate-ciliate at base; disc corollas glabrous or nearly so; pappi outer crowns of paleae or narrow squamellae 0.5–1 mm plus 8–15 barbellate inner bristles, length 1 / 3 – 1 / 2 disc corollas
